sources.title: "Shore Leave" (1925) director John S. Robertson
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation     "Shore Leave" is a nice romantic story. This film illustrates the work of director John S. Robertson, a star of Silent Hall of Fame. Directed by                  John S. Robertson Produced by                Richard Barthelmess Scenario                      Josephine Lovett Based on                       the play Shore Leave by Hubert Osborne Starring                        Richard Barthelmess, Dorothy Mackaill Cinematography          Roy Overbaugh, Stewart Nelson Editing by                     William Hamilton Distributed by              First National Pictures Release date                 September 6, 1925 Running time               90 minutes Country                        US Language                      Silent film Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

metadata.Plot: While anchored down on a small New England port, on shore leave, Bilge Smith, a sailor, meets Connie Martin, the village dressmaker. Upon leaving, Bilge promises to return to Connie.
metadata.Writer: Josephine Lovett, Hubert Osborne, Agnes Smith
metadata.Actors: Richard Barthelmess, Dorothy Mackaill, Ted McNamara
